title: Can You See Who Viewed Your Instagram Profile?

steps.title: No—you can't see exactly which users viewed your profile.
steps.content: No—you can't see exactly which users viewed your profile. If you're concerned about someone knowing how often you've checked their profile, don't worry. Instagram has not released a feature that lets users know which specific users are snooping (yet). If you're curious about who's looking at your profile, you can upgrade to a professional account to see the number of profile visits . This is only the number of hits your profile has, not individual users. There may be third-party apps that claim you can see who viewed your profile. However, these apps may lock you out of your account or get your account permanently banned . Be wary of any third-party apps that involve entering your login information. While users can’t see who looked at their profile, they can still see who viewed their Stories .

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app. This looks like a camera icon with a multicolored background. Use this method if you have a professional account and want to check your profile's hits. This won't work for regular accounts .

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You can find this in the bottom-right corner. On some devices, this may look like a person icon.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This will be at the top-right corner. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Insights.
steps.content: Tap Insights . If you don't see this section, you don't have a professional account. You'll need to upgrade first. [1] X Research source

steps.title: View your profile hits.
steps.content: View your profile hits. You'll see a page of metrics under the Overview section along with any posted content you have. You can find your profile hits below Interactions .
